name: British Virgin Islands
description: The British Virgin Islands (BVI) are a stunning archipelago in the Caribbean Sea, renowned for their pristine beaches, turquoise waters, and thriving marine life. Comprising Tortola, Virgin Gorda, and Jost Van Dyke, the islands offer a unique blend of luxury tourism, adventurous activities, and unspoiled natural beauty.  The BVI is a British Overseas Territory, and its economy is largely driven by tourism and financial services.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of the BVI is relatively small, contributing to the islands' relaxed atmosphere.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of residents are of Caribbean descent, with a significant British influence.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The islands are compact, making them easy to explore.
quickFacts.detail: Tortola is the largest island, covering approximately 60% of the total area.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency is the Eastern Caribbean Dollar.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: The economy is heavily reliant on tourism and financial services.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism contributes approximately 60% of the GDP.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, with Caribbean Creole widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Spanish is also spoken by a small percentage of the population.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: The British Virgin Islands enjoy a consistently warm and humid tropical climate year-round, influenced by trade winds. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year, with a slightly wetter season from June to November.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer brings consistently warm temperatures and high humidity. Rainfall is more frequent, often occurring in the afternoon.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual decrease in rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures. The seas remain calm and inviting.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is considered the dry season, with lower humidity and less rainfall. Temperatures are comfortable and ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return to warmer temperatures and increased humidity. Rainfall remains moderate.

naturalWonders.name: The Baths
naturalWonders.description: The Baths are a unique geological formation on Virgin Gorda, featuring a series of giant granite boulders creating natural pools and grottoes.  The area is rich in marine life and offers stunning coastal scenery.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The boulders were formed over millions of years by volcanic activity and erosion. The pools are filled with seawater and provide a sheltered environment for snorkeling and swimming.
viewingTips: Wear sturdy shoes for navigating the rocks

naturalWonders.name: Sage Hill
naturalWonders.description: Sage Hill is a prominent coastal hill on Tortola, offering panoramic views of the surrounding islands and the Caribbean Sea. It's a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The hill is covered in native vegetation, including sagebrush and other coastal plants.  It provides a crucial habitat for various bird species.
viewingTips: Check the weather forecast before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Coral Gardens
naturalWonders.description: Coral Gardens is a vibrant underwater ecosystem teeming with colorful coral reefs, diverse fish species, and other marine life. It's a popular destination for snorkeling and diving.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reef is composed of various coral species, including brain coral, staghorn coral, and elkhorn coral. It provides shelter and food for a wide range of marine organisms.

biodiversityCategory.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategory.description: The British Virgin Islands boast an incredibly rich marine biodiversity, largely due to the surrounding coral reefs and seagrass beds. The waters are home to a vast array of fish, invertebrates, and marine mammals.

statistics.details: Includes numerous species of reef fish, pelagic fish, and sharks.
Diverse coral communities support a complex food web.

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Migrates to the BVI to breed during the winter months.

notableSpecies.name: Loggerhead Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: Nests on the beaches of the BVI.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The British Virgin Islands are characterized by a diverse range of coastal ecosystems, including coral reefs, seagrass beds, mangrove forests, and sandy beaches. These ecosystems provide vital habitat for marine life and protect the islands from erosion.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: As detailed above, the marine ecosystems are incredibly diverse and important.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Mangrove forests provide critical nursery grounds for fish and other marine organisms, and they also protect the coastline from storm surges.

statistics.details: Found primarily along the eastern coast of Tortola.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: The British Virgin Islands offer a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands' lush interior and stunning coastal trails.

activities.name: Sage Hill Trail
activities.description: A scenic hike to the summit of Sage Hill, offering panoramic views.

activities.name: Mount Eboyan Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the peak of Mount Eboyan, offering stunning views of the surrounding islands.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, plenty of water, snacks

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in the crystal-clear waters of the BVI.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: The BVI is renowned as a sailing paradise.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, waterproof jacket, sweater
